questions.text: What are the two primary data structures in Pandas? (Select two)
questions.explanation: Pandas introduces the Series (1D labeled array) and DataFrame (2D labeled tabular structure).

questions.text: How is missing data typically represented in Pandas?
questions.explanation: NaN (Not a Number), a special floating-point value, is the primary marker for missing numerical data in Pandas. `None` can also appear in object arrays.

questions.text: When performing arithmetic operations between two Pandas Series, data is aligned automatically based on integer position.
questions.explanation: Pandas automatically aligns data by index labels when performing operations between Series, not by integer position. Where labels don't match, NaN is often introduced.
